result.execSummary:
The defendant Cole M. Zomok was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs/surcharges to be paid in installments of $100.00 per month commencing 06-01-2019 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cole M. Zomok

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Cole M. Zomok
Current: 438 W Church St, Ellsworth, WI 54011 United States  (Effective: 04-17-2019)
Prior: W9550 Sth 35, Pepin, WI 54759

01:39 PM Defendant Cole M. Zomok in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Defendant Cole M. Zomok in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Zomok will plead guilty, parties ask he pay the costs.  He FTA on original 20 days sentence with 15 days withheld.  He sat 20 days w/o good time.  Circumstances appropriate to pay costs, no additional jail.  Atty Hughes confirms and informs Mr. Zomok was unable to have huber.  Courts advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and reviews rights giving up and reviews plea questionnaire.  Court finds Mr. Zomok knowingly, voluntarily & intelligently waived his constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Atty Hughes finds sufficient facts to support the plea.  Court accepts plea, finds him guilty.  Defendant addresses his right of allocution.  Court orders costs of $443.00, no additional jail.  $100/mo. com. 6/1.  Advised of appeal rights

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 16, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

01:46 PM Defendant Cole M. Zomok in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge.   Here today to discuss modification of his bond conditions, letter filed April 1, 2019 regarding modification of bond.  Court reviewed the notes of March 27 hearing, return to custody to begin serving your jail sentence and $1000 cash bond set.  Court asked this hearing be set regarding your position in bail.  Defendant informs he lives in Ellsworth, willing to sit his 20 days, has a job which is employer will keep for him but can't come up with $1000, ask if can get it reduced, could pay $250.  State has no objection for bond being reduced.  There is still the pending case and will have the ability to issue a warrant.   Court modifies bond to $250 cash.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 7, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on April 2, 2019 at 01:45 pm.

02:42 PM Defendant Cole M. Zomok in court, in custody.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of right to attorney.  Defendant willing to proceed w/o an atty.  State informs defendant was charged in 16CM29 for failure to report to jail filed 7/25/2016 for underlying case 16CM11 with conviction of July, 2016 and sentenced to 20 days in the PCJ, 15 days stayed if paid court ordered obligations & report shortly thereafter & failed to report.  State reviews the charges in 16CM29/max. penalties, ask for $1000 cash bond and set for AIA for 4/16 @ 1:30 p.m. In 2016CM11 Court orders he return to custody of jail to begin serving jail sentence.  Court sets $1000 cash bail.  Court advises defendant of his rights.  State confirms 20 days is straight jail.  Court strongly urges defendant to contact the PD office.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 16, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
